intro: Navarretia bella, commonly known as the fairy bells, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the bellflower family (Campanulaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, often in coastal areas. Navarretia bella is a short-lived perennial that produces numerous small flowers in early spring. Its name reflects the appearance of its blooms, which resemble tiny bells swaying in the breeze.
